title: Thailand Consumer Confidence
description: Consumer Confidence in Thailand increased to 46.10 points in October from 44.60 points in September of 2022. Consumer Confidence in Thailand averaged 75.47 points from 1998 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 112.40 points in December of 2003 and a record low of 39.60 points in August of 2021. In Thailand, the Consumer Confidence Index (CCI) measures consumerâ€™s outlook about current and future economic conditions, job prospects and income expectations. The index is based on a survey of around 2440 households. An index above 100 indicates an improving outlook and below 100 a deteriorating outlook. This page provides - Thailand Consumer Confidence - actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: University of the Thai Chamber of Commerce
